hackathon-description-text: MenloHacks III is the third edition of the official hackathon for Menlo School in Atherton, CA. The third edition of MenloHacks is bigger and bolder than ever before, with more hackers, more workshops, and even better food and swag.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of Data Digital Services, Ford Mobility

hackathon-eligibility: Any high school student who has been admitted to MenloHacks and uploaded the required forms is eligible to attend. The organizers may deny entry to anyone at their sole and absolute discretion.
hackathon-requirements: Make your project, submit your hack to Devpost and present to our panel of judges to show off what you built. You
hackathon-rules:
1. You must be physically at MenloHacks to participate.
2. All code for your project must be written at the event. Brainstorming ahead of time is acceptable and open source libraries can be used so long as the open source library was published at least 30 days before the event.
3. The maximum team size is 4. 
4. You cannot steal the source code from another team.
5. All judging decisions are final.
6. You must follow the 
 and any instructions or rules given by chaperones and organizers during the event. 
 
Failure to follow any of these rules will result not just in disqualification from MenloHacks III judging, but you will also not be allowed to attend any future MenloHacks event at the sole and absolute discretion of the Director of MenloHacks.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 400 dollars in cash for the team. For each member of the team: Wolfram|One Personal Edition + Wolfram Alpha Pro + Sketch License + a Hydro Flask water bottle + a free 1 hour consultation with Cardinal Education.

300 dollars in cash for the team. For each member of the team: Wolfram|One Personal Edition + Wolfram Alpha Pro + Sketch License + a Hydro Flask water bottle + a free 1 hour consultation with Cardinal Education.
200 dollars in cash for the team. For each member of the team: Wolfram|One Personal Edition + Wolfram Alpha Pro + a free 1 hour consultation with Cardinal Education.
Wolfram Alpha Pro and Wolfram|One Personal Edition for each member of the team + a free 1 hour consultation with Cardinal Education for each member of the team.
Wolfram Alpha Pro and Wolfram|One Personal Edition for each member of the team + a free 1 hour consultation with Cardinal Education for each member of the team.

Best hack that is centered around innovations with hardware rather than software. Wolfram Alpha Pro and Wolfram|One Personal Edition for each member of the team + a free 1 hour consultation with Cardinal Education for each member of the team.
Entry tickets to the Cloudflare Internet Summit ($499 value) in Summer/Fall, 2018 in San Francisco or London, for each member of the team.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=50 Valparaiso Ave, Atherton, CA 94027, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is your project unique or original? Does it take an interesting or creative approach to a problem?
Does your project solve a problem that actually exists? Is it feasible for people to use this product in the real world?
Does your project look nice? Does it have a design interface or design?
Is your project more than just a few mockup designs or a landing page? Does it actually work?

hackathon-description-header: MenloHacks is back, bigger and better than ever before.
